_header: As I stood in a park straight up by a tree
Note:
Ringler Jr. (1992)
XRingler Jr., William A. Bibliography and Index of English Verse in Manuscript 1501-1558. London: Mansell, 1992; prepared and completed by Michael Rudick and Susan J. Ringler , TM 197.
_description: John Lacy, ‘Wyl Bucke his Testament’ — in rhyme royal stanzas

BLCottJulAV.First Lines:
As I stode in A park streght bi A treMy Arrow in my hand my bow
                    redibent…
BLCottJulAV.Last Lines:
…havok to þe doggis both yong & oldeLet euery howund
                    byt & kep wel hys hold…
BLCottJulAV.Note:
8 stanzas. Final line is indecipherable. The text is incomplete, missing
                    the last 4 stanzas that appear in Rawlinson C.813.

BodRawC813.First Lines:
As I stode yn a parke streyght vpe by a treemy narowe yn my hande
                    my bowe redye bente…
BodRawC813.Last Lines:
…of all crysten men I truste to hym aloneI may noo more speke
                    my brethe ys all gone
BodRawC813.Editions:
Padelford,  Frederick Morgan. 
             “Liedersammlungen des xvi. Jahrhunderts…IV.” 
             Anglia
         31 (1908): 309-96: 350-2.
Jansen,  Sharon L.,  and  Kathleen H. Jordan, eds.  
             The Welles Anthology: MS. Rawlinson C.813: A Critical Edition.
         Binghamton, NY: Medieval & Renaissance Texts and Studies,
            1991: 150-4.
